author: Michael S. Derby
title: Fed’s Rosengren: Fiscal Policy Might Not Help in Next Downturn
text:
Federal Reserve Bank of Boston President Eric Rosengren warned Friday that recently passed tax cuts and spending increases are raising risks that authorities won’t have a full tool kit to counter the next downturn.
Despite that caution, Mr. Rosengren said he is optimistic about the outlook in general, in a speech in Boston. He expects the economy to perform slightly better than many of his Fed colleagues, which points to more rate rises than what most officials have penciled in.
